structured.description: And instantiates several schemas, spaces, and weights for a recommendation system using Superlinked framework. It creates an index with multiple spaces and effects based on event types and event weights. The index is used in a query that retrieves products based on user preferences and applies weights to the results. The query is executed by a RestExecutor using RedisVectorDatabase.

items.description: Defines a schema for product data, specifying attributes such as description, name, category, price, review count and rating, and an ID.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Required for a product's description. It can hold any text data about the product, providing more information to customers before they make a purchase.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Required for product objects, representing the name or title of a product.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: A characteristic or classification of the product, which represents its grouping within a product hierarchy.

attributes.name: price
attributes.description: A numerical value representing the cost of a product.

attributes.name: review_count
attributes.description: A count of reviews for a product.

attributes.name: review_rating
attributes.description: Part of the product schema definition, representing the average rating given by customers to a particular product based on the number of reviews received.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Designated to uniquely identify a product instance.

items.name: ProductSchema

items.description: Defines a data model for user preferences, comprising four attributes: `preference_description`, `preference_name`, `preference_category`, and `id`. It represents a structured representation of user preferences, enabling efficient storage and retrieval.

attributes.name: preference_description
attributes.description: Part of the schema for a user's preferences. It represents a brief description of the preference.

attributes.name: preference_name
attributes.description: Part of the schema definition for a user entity. It represents the name of a user's preference.

attributes.name: preference_category
attributes.description: A field within the schema that represents a category for user preferences.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Part of the UserSchema definition. It represents a unique identifier for each user in the system.

items.name: UserSchema

items.description: Defines a data structure for events, comprising references to product and user schemas, an event type, and three fields for storing unique identifiers and timestamps: `id`, `created_at`.

attributes.name: event_type
attributes.description: A part of the schema definition for events. It represents the type of event being described, allowing for categorization and organization of different types of events.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Not further defined in this snippet. It likely represents a unique identifier for each event.

attributes.name: created_at
attributes.description: Not further defined. It likely represents a timestamp indicating when the event was created.

items.name: EventSchema
